item.title: Gunzip into dd: don't forget `-c`
item.description: Recently I was trying to copy the contents of one SD card to an identically-sized blank card, and ran into the problem of dd apparently stalling when writing to the new card, writing out zero records. Hereâ€™s the command I used to read the first card: sudo dd bs=4M if=/dev/sda1 status=progress|gzip > wee.img.gz Notice the use of gzip to compress the output coming out of dd. This is just to reduce the 90 GB or so of empty space on the card to (almost) nothing so my hard disk could hold the image.
